fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Transport, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: EU initiatives falling broadly under the categories of energy, environment and chemicals. For example: EU energy strategy 2030, EU ETS, Energy Union (Clean Energy Package), trade, GHG related legislation, biofuel legislation and renewable energy, transport fuels related initiatives, Industrial Emissions Directive, Air Quality, REACH, phthalates, natural gas policy including shale gas,  energy efficiency legislation, HC Guidance Document, sustainable finance.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
persons_accredited_for_access_to_europea: BAECKELMANS#Nikolaas, GABA#Khurram Razaq, HARGROVE#ELAINE, ONACA#Alex Christian, SCHARPÉ#Johan, SZILVASI#Matyas
membership:
List of main EU organizations with activities related to the scope of the Register, of which ExxonMobil subsidiaries are members (2016): 
- European trade associations: CONCAWE/FuelsEurope, IOGP, CEFIC, AmCham EU, BusinessEurope 
 
ExxonMobil subsidiaries in the EU are also members of national trade and industry associations which may have varying degrees of engagement with European Institutions.
goals__remit: ExxonMobil is one of Europe's largest oil and gas producers, a major refiner of crude oil for fuels and lubricants, and one of Europe's leading petrochemical companies. ExxonMobil's primary role - and most important benefit to society - is to safely provide reliable and affordable energy supplies to people around the world. Doing this well is essential to improving standards of living, and we are committed to doing so in a financially, environmentally and socially responsible manner.
